summary: In fiscal year 2018, DOD provided tuition assistance for about 200,000 servicemembers who enrolled in over 600,000 courses. The cost was about $425 million. About 7% of this assistance benefited active-duty officers. When active-duty officers use this benefit, they increase the length of time they must remain in military service. Congress may change the policy so that this committed time is served consecutively—not concurrently. A...
title: DOD Education Benefits: Data on Officer Participation in and Views on Proposed Changes to the Tuition Assistance Program
